title: Sols 4261-4262: Drill Sol 1…Take 2
summary: Earth planning date: Wednesday, July 31, 2024 As Cat mentioned on Monday, today’s plan is a second attempt at our Drill Sol 1 activities. We’ve shifted the target on Kings Canyon a little bit, but the activities remain the same — a preload test to ensure that we’re able to safely drill here, and contact […]

title: ASCEND panel cites AI challenges and promise
summary: LAS VEGAS – Space organizations are continuing to identify promising applications of artificial intelligence, according to speakers at the AIAA ASCEND conference here. At NASA, for example, AI helps aggregate […]

title: Boeing Takes Another Financial Hit Due to Starliner
summary: In its quarterly earnings report today, Boeing acknowledged that delays in the Starliner program have cost it another $125 million. The company has had to spend more than $1 billion […]

title: System-Wide Safety Project Description
summary: A new era of aviation is here, and NASA’s System-Wide Safety (SWS) project is developing innovative data solutions to assure safe, rapid, and repeatable access to a transformed National Airspace System (NAS). SWS was created in 2018 and is part of NASA Aeronautics’ Airspace Operations and Safety Program. SWS evaluates how the aerospace industry and […]

summary: System-Wide Safety (SWS) project leaders are listed here. title: Cooperative Blending of Autonomous Landing Technology (COBALT)
summary: Cooperative Blending of Autonomous Landing Technology is a reusable platform for spaceflight infusion of guidance, navigation and control (GN&C) as well as precision landing and hazard avoidance technologies.

title: Composite Cryotank Technologies and Demonstration (CCTD)
summary: The  primary objective of the Composite Cryotank Technologies and Demonstration (CCTD) project is to mature the technology readiness of composite cryogenic propellant tanks at diameters that are suitable for future heavy lift vehicles and other in-space applications.

title: The Marshall Star for July 31, 2024
summary: SLS Core Stage Rolls Inside Vehicle Assembly Building at Kennedy NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket core stage for the Artemis II mission is inside the Vehicle Assembly Building at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center. Tugboats and towing vessels moved the barge and core stage 900-miles to the Florida spaceport from NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility, where it was […]

title: Successful Static Fire Leads to Final Preparation Before Full Stack
summary: Activities at Starbase are on full throttle as Starship flight five pulls ever closer. Major work has been completed on Launch Pad B, altering the skyline, glimpses of the future have been witnessed with the first-ever Block 2 starship, and Ship 30 completed a second static fire with full-stack testing on the horizon.

title: Autonomous Medical Operations (AMO)
summary: The Autonomous Medical Operations (AMO) project supports NASA’s strategic thrust to advance “human augmentation” capabilities.
